dialog.speaker: Arthur (Male)
dialog.utterance: Stay back. I may be wounded, but I'm still armed.

dialog.speaker: Arthur (Male)
dialog.utterance: How'd you get past my traps, anyway?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I've got "moves."

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Forget about that, what are YOU doing in this cave?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You call those traps? I've seen nanner peels that were more dangerous.

dialog.speaker: Arthur (Male)
dialog.utterance: Just remember I still got "bullets." In case you get any funny ideas.

dialog.speaker: Arthur (Male)
dialog.utterance: What are you doing out here, anyway?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Let me take a look at your wounds...

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What's with all the traps?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Catherine told me some of her couriers had gone missing out here.

dialog.speaker: Arthur (Male)
dialog.utterance: That feels a mite better. Wish I had something to give you, but I gnawed through my last spratwurst an hour ago.

dialog.speaker: Arthur (Male)
dialog.utterance: Cave like this makes a handy place to store goods or hide out for a spell. And the traps usually keep gawkers out.

dialog.speaker: Arthur (Male)
dialog.utterance: Nice to know she cares.

dialog.speaker: Arthur (Male)
dialog.utterance: Catherine had us making drops for some big-shot client out here. And before you ask, I don't know who they are. Or were.

dialog.speaker: Arthur (Male)
dialog.utterance: The whole point of making drops in the middle of nowhere was to keep their identity and whereabouts a secret.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You think they're dead?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Looks like that turned out well.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Get to the part where you're hiding in a cave.

dialog.speaker: Arthur (Male)
dialog.utterance: The marauders knew we were coming - rigged the bridge with explosives and everything.

dialog.speaker: Arthur (Male)
dialog.utterance: If they found us, my guess is they found the client, too.

dialog.speaker: Arthur (Male)
dialog.utterance: Yeah. I guess the marauders noticed, 'cause they were waiting for us. Blew the bridge and took off with the goods.

dialog.speaker: Arthur (Male)
dialog.utterance: Marauders were waiting for us. They blew the bridge and took off with the shipment.

dialog.speaker: Arthur (Male)
dialog.utterance: Hiding from the marauders that hit us, obviously.

dialog.speaker: Arthur (Male)
dialog.utterance: Now your turn.

dialog.speaker: Arthur (Male)
dialog.utterance: Well, you don't gotta be mean about it.
